snippet: Daniel K. Inouye, who served nearly 48 years in the Senate, was a Democrat who broke racial barriers on Capitol Hill.
abstract: Sen Daniel K Inouye of Hawaii, who went to Washington at the birth of his state in 1959, dominated public life in the Hawaiian islands for more than 50 years and became a quiet voice of national conscience during the Watergate scandal and the Iran-contra affair, dies at age 88.
lead_paragraph: Daniel K. Inouye, who served nearly 48 years in the Senate, was a Democrat who broke racial barriers on Capitol Hill.

headline.seo: Daniel Inouye, Hawaii’s Quiet Voice of Conscience in Senate, Dies at 88
headline.main: Daniel Inouye, Hawaii’s Quiet Voice of Conscience in Senate, Dies at 88
headline.print_headline: Daniel Inouye, Hawaii’s Quiet Voice of Conscience in Senate, Is Dead at 88
